Sentencas: H-2/D-2 pulse isotope exchange experiments were employed for the first time to gain insight into the hydrogen oxidation mechanism of proton conducting solid oxide fuel cell electrode materials.
Titulo: On the H2/D2 isotopic exchange rate of proton conducting barium cerates and zirconates

Sentencas: Phase pure perovskites, BaCeO3 (BC), BaCe0.9Y0.1O3-delta (BCY), BaZrO3 (BZ) and BaZr0.9Y0.1O3-delta (BZY) were synthesized.
Titulo: On the H2/D2 isotopic exchange rate of proton conducting barium cerates and zirconates

Sentencas: The experiment was performed in both dry and wet H-2, isotopic exchange was clearly observed over all samples between 250 and 525 degrees C in dry H-2, 425 and 725 degrees C in wet H-2.
Titulo: On the H2/D2 isotopic exchange rate of proton conducting barium cerates and zirconates

Sentencas: The conversion of D-2 reached above 88% at 375 degrees C in BC and BCY, 550 and 425 degrees C in BZ and BZY respectively; however, no significant difference in rate was observed between the materials.
Titulo: On the H2/D2 isotopic exchange rate of proton conducting barium cerates and zirconates

Sentencas: Surface composition analysis via High Sensitivity-Low Energy Ion Scattering (HS-LEIS) and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) revealed significant Ba enrichment on the outermost surface (71.1-87.1%, fractional surface coverage of Ba).
Titulo: On the H2/D2 isotopic exchange rate of proton conducting barium cerates and zirconates

Sentencas: It is suggested that this similar surface composition leads to similar catalytic activity.
Titulo: On the H2/D2 isotopic exchange rate of proton conducting barium cerates and zirconates

Sentencas: Significant rate enhancement was observed upon 1 wt% surface doping with active transition metal catalysts, Ni, Pt and Co.
Titulo: On the H2/D2 isotopic exchange rate of proton conducting barium cerates and zirconates

Sentencas: We suggest that hydrogen dissociation occurs primarily on the metallic component of H+-SOFC cermet anodes.
Titulo: On the H2/D2 isotopic exchange rate of proton conducting barium cerates and zirconates
